body: Sounds like a good idea to me.  @nunit/framework-team ?

I think it's a neat idea. Filtering by namespace could be another option here, but that requires knowledge of the target test assembly and it's more difficult to generalize. This is a bit more elegant.

We have a bit of a known issue where dynamic values in a ValueSource can change between discovery and execution (#3894) which could complicate this if we were to use a hashed test name. However we partition should ideally be unchanging in all scenarios. Perhaps test id is a better option? It's not 100% deterministic (#2771) but at least it's less dynamic and should be good enough for this case

Thank you for the feedback; perhaps to simplify could we consider just treating all permutations (TestCase) of the same fully-qualified test name as the same (for partitioning purposes)? The nice thing about just indicating the partition number and total count is that we don't need to document/configure/list namespaces (complicated) to just run a subset of (arbitrary) tests.

A future improvement could be to internally switch to deterministic test-IDs (at a test permutation level / TestCase too) when that is possible to improve the partitioning, which can be an implementation detail.

@Plasma  I think that's a great idea. I was close to suggesting that myself initially üòÅ
@nunit/framework-team Thoughts or concerns with this approach?

issue.title: Add PartitionFilter to run a subset of tests based off a hash/partition key
issue.body:
# Overview
Added a new filter, PartitionFilter, that allows you to filter to a subset of arbitrary tests based on a partition number and count.

This is helpful when you may want to run a subset of tests (eg, across 3 machines - or partitions), each with a separately assigned partition number and fixed partition count

Fixes #4391

body:
I've added #4392 as an initial prototype for feedback.

I had trouble testing this outside of the nunit project, I couldn't get nunit from source to work with `dotnet test` on a test project (any pointers appreciated) as it always complaints no tests were found, even with the Test SDK and adapter from nuget installed.
@Plasma Which version of the adapter are you using?  Since you're branching off main, you need the 4.5 version which is in alpha.
